metadata.title: CVE-2012-5526 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
CGI.pm module before 3.63 for Perl does not properly escape newlines in (1)Set-Cookie or (2) P3P headers, which might allow remote attackers to injectarbitrary headers into responses from applications that use CGI.pm.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libperl5.20 - 5.14.2-16
perl - 5.14.2-16
perl-base - 5.14.2-16
perl-debug - 5.14.2-16
perl-modules - 5.14.2-16
No subscription required

libcgi-pm-perl - 3.64-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.14.2-16').
libcgi-pm-perl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.64-1').
